intro: Rottboellia thyrsoidea, commonly known as the panicle grass, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions. It belongs to the grass family Poaceae and is characterized by its tufted growth habit and dense, branched inflorescences. The plant produces small, spikelet-based flowers that are typically green or pale in color. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in open areas, disturbed sites, and along roadsides. Rottboellia thyrsoidea is also sometimes cultivated as an ornamental grass due to its attractive foliage and growth form.
